Opening pages of 'Fun Home,' by Alison Bechdel, published by Mariner Books.

Introduction

The story starts off with Alison reminiscing her early childhood experiences with her father, then it continues with her expressing why she sees him in such a negative light. Throughout the tragicomic, it can be inferred that Alison's lack of sympathy toward their father's passing was due to the absence of a warm parent-child relationship throughout their childhood. Alison views their father as an unreasonable person, and an unconventional father.




Thesis Statement

Alison treats their father's death not only as a life-changing tragedy but also as a comedy. Alison takes on a more casual attitude towards death, indicating that the social development of their family was rather unorthodox.



    Chapters 1-2 opening pages of 'Fun Home,' by Alison Bechdel, published by Mariner Books.
